intro: Spiloxene flaccida, commonly known as the slender spiloxene, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its delicate, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and sandy soils. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its stems are usually erect and somewhat sprawling. Spiloxene flaccida is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
